lines.content: * A class to abstract a deadline which is a type of task with a date
* Creates a new deadline task based on the input by a user.
* @param input An input in the form of a task name followed by the keyword "-by"
*              then followed by the task deadline.
* A chat bot that is capable of recording tasks.
* Todos: Tasks without any date attached.
* Deadlines: Tasks that need to be done before a specific date.
* Events: Tasks that start at a specific time and ends at a specific time.
public static final String DEADLINE_FORMAT = "deadline {Deadline name} -by {Date to be completed by}";
public static final String EVENT_FORMAT = "event {Event name} -at {Date of event}";
public static final String TODO_FORMAT = "todo {todo name}";
* When run, opens a chat bot that greets the user and echos any user's input. If the input
* is bye the chat bot is closed.
System.out.println("What can I help you with?\n");
System.out.println("Bye!! Hope to see you again!!");
* A class that represent an event which is a type of task that starts
* and ends at a specific dead or time.
* Creates a new event task based on the input by a user.
* @param input An input in the form of a event name followed by the keyword "-at"
*              then followed by the timing of the event.
* A class that abstracts a task.
* Get a description of the task filled with its details.

* A class that abstracts a list of tasks set by the user.
private final ArrayList<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<>();
* Add a task to the task list.
* @param task The task to be added to the task list.
System.out.println("Got it! This task has been added:");
* Prints the task list for the user to view.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Marks a task in the task list as completed based on the index given.
* @param index The index of the task list. Note that the index provided starts from 1. So the index 1 represents
*              the first task in the taskList ArrayList.
System.out.println("This task has already been completed.\n");
System.out.println("congratulations! This task has been completed:");
* A type of task that does not have a specified date or time.
* Creates a new task that is to be done.
* @param taskName The name of the task.
* A class responsible for reading and evaluating user inputs.
* Takes the user input to the chat bot.
* @param scanner The scanner used to scan for user input.
* @return The user input as a String.
* Evaluates a user's input to the chat bot and carries out the appropriate functions.
* @return False if the user's input is supposed to close the chat bot. Else, the chat bot continues
* and wait for the user to input another word.
